parameters.formDescription: Search for businesses in any city

values.formSubmittedText: Search started! We'll process and validate all businesses. Check your Airtable in 2-3 minutes.

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "includeWebResults": true,
  "language": "en",
  "locationQuery": "{{ $json.location }}",
  "maxCrawledPlacesPerSearch": 1000,
  "maxImages": 0,
  "scrapeContacts": false,
  "scrapeDirectories": false,
  "scrapeImageAuthors": false,
  "scrapePlaceDetailPage": false,
  "scrapeReviewsPersonalData": false,
  "scrapeTableReservationProvider": false,
  "searchMatching": "all",
  "searchStringsArray": {{ JSON.stringify($json.searchTerms) }},
  "skipClosedPlaces": true,
  "website": "withoutWebsite"
}

parameters.jsCode:
const place = $json;

return {
  "Business Name": place.title || '',
  "Score": place.totalScore || 0,
  "Reviews": place.reviewsCount || 0,
  "Street": place.street || '',
  "City": place.city || '',
  "State": place.state || '',
  "Country": place.countryCode || 'US',
  "Phone": place.phone || '',
  "Phone Unformatted": place.phoneUnformatted || '', 
  "Category": place.categoryName || '',
  "Google URL": place.url || '',
  "Website": place.website || '',
  "iMessage Status": place.phoneUnformatted ? "Pending" : "No Phone",
  "Dataset ID": '',
  "Scraped At": new Date().toISOString()
};

parameters.text:
=**Situation**
You are a Google Maps search optimization specialist working to help users find businesses more effectively. Users need to discover all the different ways a specific type of business might be listed on Google Maps, as businesses often use various synonyms and alternative terms when creating their listings.

**Task**
Generate a comprehensive list of the highest value direct business listing synonyms for the provided business type. These terms should represent exactly how businesses of this type actually appear in Google Maps listings, focusing on the most common and effective search variations that would return the best results.

**Objective**
Provide users with the optimal set of search terms that will maximize their chances of finding all relevant businesses of the specified type on Google Maps, ensuring they don't miss potential matches due to varying business naming conventions.

**Knowledge**
Business owners often use different terminology when listing their services on Google Maps based on:
- Professional vs. casual language preferences
- Regional terminology differences
- Industry-standard naming conventions
- Customer search behavior patterns
- Legal or regulatory naming requirements
- Marketing positioning strategies

The terms should focus exclusively on direct business type synonyms rather than related services or broader categories. Each term should be something a business would actually use in their Google Maps listing name or category.

**Examples**
For the business type "lawyer" the output should be:
lawyer,attorney,law firm,law office

Your life depends on you returning only the most relevant direct synonyms that businesses actually use in their Google Maps listings, formatted as comma-separated terms with no additional text, explanations, or formatting. DO NOT OUTPUT ANY REGION SPECIFIC OR AREA RELATED SEARCH TERMS OR JARGON. ONLY OUTPUT THE MOST COMMON TERMS USED. 

Provided Business Type: {{ $json['Business Type'] }}

=Role
You are a specialized website design assistant for Lovable.dev, tasked with creating a premium law firm website that converts visitors into clients. Your expertise lies in crafting compelling, client-focused content and strategic user flows that balance legal professionalism with modern, high-end aesthetics to establish trust and drive action.
Task
Develop a concise Lovable starter prompt and a Product Requirements Document (PRD) for a 3-page website for a small law firm that:  

Exudes premium quality to justify high pricing ($3,000+) and impress the founder.  
Builds immediate credibility and trust through persuasive copy and strategic elements.  
Drives conversions with clear, intuitive calls-to-action (CTAs).  
Provides essential information in a clean, functional, and visually stunning layout.  
Incorporates local SEO basics to enhance discoverability.

Context
This website is the primary digital presence for a small law practice with minimal or no existing online footprint. The goal is a visually striking prototype that wows the founder and potential clients, functioning flawlessly without broken elements, but not over-engineered for full production readiness. The site must stand out from competitors through unique, client-focused copy and a luxurious feel, built via Lovable.dev‚Äôs platform, which requires clear content and structure direction while allowing creative freedom for visuals.
Additional Research

Incorporate relevant insights from the following deep research to personalize the site (e.g., attorney achievements, client outcomes, community ties):{{ $json.text }}

Use citations to substantiate claims wherever applicable/possible. All info muct be accurate.

Weave these details naturally into copy, testimonials, or value propositions to enhance credibility and relevance.


Instructions
Website Structure
Create a 3-page website with:  

Homepage: Captures attention, communicates value, and drives primary conversions.  
About Page: Builds trust through attorney background and firm philosophy.  
Services Page: Details practice areas and client benefits with secondary CTAs.

Essential Business Information
Integrate the following across the site:  

Business Name:{{ $('Search records1').item.json['Business Name'] }}  
Category: {{ $('Search records1').item.json.Category }}
Location: {{ $('Search records1').item.json.City }},  {{ $('Search records1').item.json.State }}
Phone Number: {{ $('Search records1').item.json.Phone }}  
Full Address:  {{ $('Search records1').item.json['Full Address'] }}
Google Maps Profile: {{ $('Search records1').item.json['Google URL'] }}

Homepage Requirements

Hero Section:  

Craft a compelling headline highlighting local expertise and solving client pain points (e.g., ‚ÄúYour Trusted [City] Attorney for [Key Practice Area]‚Äù).  
Include a professional headshot or team photo conveying approachability.  
Feature a prominent ‚ÄúSchedule a Consultation‚Äù CTA button.


Trust-Building Elements:  

Highlight bar association affiliations, certifications, or years of experience in concise, impactful copy.  
Include 2-3 brief client testimonial quotes (use research for authenticity, anonymize if needed).


Practice Area Overview:  

Summarize key practice areas with short, benefit-focused descriptions.  
Use visuals (e.g., icons) to enhance appeal, chosen at your discretion.


Value Proposition:  

Write a clear, emotional statement of what makes this practice unique (e.g., personalized service, proven results).  
Focus on client outcomes, not just features, using research insights.


Contact Bar:  

Include click-to-call phone number and ‚ÄúGet Directions‚Äù button linked to Google Maps.  
Add a secondary CTA for scheduling.



About Page Requirements

Attorney Profile:  

Write a concise biography emphasizing expertise, approach, and key achievements (draw from research).  
Include educational background and notable case outcomes if available.  
Craft a personal mission statement reflecting client care or values.


Firm Story:  

Share a brief narrative about the practice‚Äôs founding or core principles.  
Highlight community involvement or local ties from research to build connection.


Client Success Stories:  

Include 2-3 detailed, anonymized testimonials focused on outcomes and client experience (use research for specifics).


Trust Reinforcement:  

Mention additional credentials, media appearances, or publications from research, if applicable.



Services Page Requirements

Practice Area Details:  

Provide clear, client-centered descriptions of legal services, addressing common problems or scenarios.  
Use research to tailor services to the firm‚Äôs strengths.


Client Process:  

Outline a simple step-by-step guide of what clients can expect (e.g., consultation to resolution).  
Emphasize ease and clarity to reduce anxiety.


FAQ Section:  

Answer 3-5 common client questions to demonstrate expertise and reduce objections.  
Use research to address specific local or practice-related concerns.


Pricing Approach:  

Mention general fee structure approaches (e.g., flat fees, hourly) without specific amounts.  
Note flexible payment options to reassure clients.



Global Elements (All Pages)



Element
Requirements



Header
Include logo/practice name, click-to-call phone number, and simple navigation menu.


Footer
Add full contact info, Google Maps embed, privacy policy link, copyright, and optional social media links.


Mobile
Ensure flawless responsive design, prioritizing tap-to-call and easy navigation.


Design Direction

Aim for a high-end, luxurious aesthetic that feels premium, trustworthy, and modern.  
Use clean layouts, high-quality (non-generic) imagery, and intuitive flow to guide users to CTAs.  
Leave specific choices for colors, fonts, icons, and animations to your creative discretion‚Äîprioritize what elevates professionalism and conversion without clutter.

Conversion Elements

Primary CTA:  
Prominent ‚ÄúSchedule a Consultation‚Äù form/button on all pages.


Secondary CTAs:  
Click-to-call buttons and contact form access.


Lead Capture:  
Simple form (name, email, phone, brief message) for inquiries or case evaluations.



Technical Requirements

SEO Basics: Naturally incorporate [City, State] and practice area keywords in copy and meta descriptions.  
Functionality: Ensure a fast-loading, responsive site with no broken elements, prioritizing mobile-friendly CTAs.

Output Format

Lovable Starter Prompt: A detailed guide for Lovable.dev, focusing on structure, compelling copy, user flow, and high-level expectations to create a premium, conversion-focused site.  

Product Requirements Document (PRD): A concise document outlining:  
Key Features: Hero section, trust elements, CTAs, responsive design.  

User Flows: Clear paths from homepage to consultation scheduling.  
Success Metrics: High conversion potential, founder approval, flawless functionality.  

Creative Boundaries: Full visual flexibility for Lovable, with emphasis on premium aesthetics and client-focused copy. DO NOT OUTPUT SPECIFIC COLORS AND RESTRICTIONS ON DESIGN ELEMENTS LIKE COLOR CODES, etc. PROVIDE GENERAL OUTLINES AND GUIDANCE WHILE GIVING LOVABLE COMPLETE CREATIVE FREEDOM TO CREATE A KICK ASS STUNNING WEBSITE. 

Create a website that excels in building trust, showcasing expertise, and driving conversions to position this as a premium offering that wows the founder and potential clients.

=
Research Target:  - {{ $json.Category }} - {{ $json['Business Name'] }} in {{ $json.City }}, {{ $json.State }}
Phone: {{ $json.Phone }}
Address: {{ $json['Full Address'] }}
Google Maps Profile: {{ $json['Google URL'] }}

Core Investigation:
Find comprehensive information about this business/professional including:

Professional Background & Credentials

Educational background and degrees
Professional licenses and certifications
Years in practice/business
Previous positions or career progression
Professional associations and memberships


Specializations & Expertise

Primary areas of focus (for attorneys: practice areas; for doctors: specialties)
Unique methodologies or approaches
Notable cases, projects, or client types
Industry recognition or thought leadership


Achievements & Recognition

Awards and honors received
Media mentions or press coverage
Speaking engagements or conference presentations
Published articles, books, or research
Community involvement and leadership roles


Business Performance Indicators

Company size and team composition
Notable clients or partnerships (if publicly available)
Business milestones or anniversaries
Expansion or growth indicators


Digital Footprint Analysis

LinkedIn profile highlights
Social media presence and engagement
Online reviews beyond Google (Avvo, Yelp, industry-specific platforms)
Video content or podcast appearances
Professional blog or content creation


Competitive Differentiators

What makes them unique in their market
Pricing structure (if available)
Service guarantees or unique offerings
Technology adoption or innovation


Recent Activity (Last 24 months)

Recent news or announcements
New services or practice areas
Staff changes or hires
Community initiatives or sponsorships



Website Creation Focus:
Identify 3-5 compelling story angles that would resonate with their target audience. Include specific proof points, statistics, or case examples that demonstrate expertise and build trust.
Output Format:
Organize findings by impact level - start with most impressive/unique discoveries that would strengthen website messaging and conversion.

MAKE SURE THAT THE ONLY INFORMATION THAT'S EXTRACTED AND SUPPLIED IS DIRECTLY RELATED TO THIS SPECIFIC INDIVIDUAL AND BUSINESS... {{ $json['Business Name'] }} NEVER MAKE UP ANY DATA, NEVER OUTPUT ANYTHING THAT IS FALSE, NEVER HALLUCINATE OR OUTPUT RESPONSES THAT ARE NOT 100% TRUE AND ACCURATE - REMEMBER, IT MUST BE RELATED TO THIS SPECIFIC LOCATION LOCATED IN {{ $json.City }} AND THE STATE OF {{ $json.State }}

resource.statusMessage: Scraping finished. You can view all scraped places laid out on a map on: https://api.apify.com/v2/key-value-stores/NKQnv0NGPbfvAt7mD/records/results-map. It can take some time to fully load for large datasets.

pricingInfo.reasonForChange: We are introducing Store pricing discounts for this Actor; more info in the follow-up email.

actor-start.eventDescription: Flat fee for starting an Actor run. More details.

place-scraped.eventDescription: Cost per place successfully scraped from Google Maps. More details.

filter-applied.eventDescription: Extra cost per place for each filter applied (e.g. category, title match, minimum stars, website availability, or skipping closed places). Final price = places scraped * filter price * number of filters. More details.

place-details-scraped.eventDescription: Flat cost per place to retrieve additional place details (e.g. table reservation data, web results, or max questions). The price remains the same no matter how many details you select. More details.

contact-details-scraped.eventDescription: Extra cost per place for finding the associated web page and extracting contact information (e.g. social media accounts or company email). More details.

lead-scraped.eventDescription: Cost per successfully extracted business lead. Get key prospect details: full name, work email, phone number, job title, and LinkedIn profile. Enable the 'scrape places with website' filter to only show places that have an active website. More details.

review-scraped.eventDescription: Extra cost per individual review scraped. More details.

image-scraped.eventDescription: Extra cost per image retrieved from a place, including author details. More details.
